name.text: Christian Martin x Desert Hearts at Necto
name.html: Christian Martin x Desert Hearts at Necto

description.text:
Necto presents...
Christian Martin x Desert Hearts [Mikey Lion | Lee Reynolds | Marbs | Porkchop]
Christian Martin's love affair with electronic music began in 1995, as an early attendee at Southern California's legendary Moontribe full moon desert parties. After absorbing late 90's club life in New York, London, and Los Angeles, Christian settled in San Francisco in the spring of 2000. He started playing records in 2002 under the tutelage of his brother, Justin Martin, armed with a stack of Justin's old vinyl and used Technics 1200's from Sammy D.
In 2003, inspired by the massive desert soundsystems of old, Christian founded the dirtybird soundsystem. Along with co-founders Justin Martin, Worthy, and Claude VonStroke, dirtybird's Sunday afternoon BBQ's have quickly become a Golden Gate Park institution.
____________________________________________________________________
Desert Hearts was manifested from an abundance of positive energy in November of 2012. Starting as a 200 person renegade gathering in the Mojave, we have grown tremendously, refining our abilities to produce world class house and techno gatherings. Home of Desert Hearts Records and our roaming City Hearts party series, we aim to spread as much love as humanly possible through music and art.
Desert Hearts started as a collaboration of San Diego based DJs Mikey Lion, Lee Reynolds, Marbs, Porkchop, and Deep Jesus alongside social influencer Christopher Kristoff. Together we put in all our love dedicating endless hours of our time to creating a beautiful place where we can gather and celebrate life through music and community.

Doors open at 9pm. 18 & over welcome with proper ID.
VIP services available. Contact: VIP@necto.com
Christian Martin : Watch | Listen | Talk | Meet | Peek
Desert Hearts : Watch | Listen | Talk | Meet | Peek

name.text: Ambassadors of Song - International Male Chorus Symposium
name.html: Ambassadors of Song - International Male Chorus Symposium

description.text:
The University of Michigan Men’s Glee Club invites singers and audiences from around the world to join us in song and celebration of the University of Michigan’s Bicentennial Anniversary at the Ambassadors of Song International Male Chorus Symposium. Register as an attendee, a group, a member of the Michigan High School Bicentennial Chorus, or an alumnus in our Ambassadors of Song Alumni Chorus. For more information, visit bicentennial.ummgc.org/ambassadors-of-song/
Additionally, please note that the "Optional Add-On: Alumni Sunday Brunch" that will take place on Sunday, November 12th is open to all alumni and spouses/partners. UMMGC alumni from two international tour groups will also be celebrating special anniversaries during the weekend. These include the 1967 World Tour Group, its 50th, and the 1992 Eastern European Tour Group, its 25th. As members of these groups (whether or not you participated in either tour), you can register to attend a reunion lunch held in the League that Friday, one for the 1967 group, another for the 1992 group. This is an optional cost.

description.text: Founded in 1859, The University of Michigan Men’s Glee Club is one of the oldest collegiate choruses in the United States and long acclaimed as one of the finest male choruses in the world. The Glee Club is known for its wide repertoire of music that incorporates selections from different musical styles and periods including Renaissance motets, Romantic anthems, opera choruses, folksongs, spirituals, contemporary works, and, of course, Michigan songs. Since the beginning of Dr. Rogers’ tenure in 2011, the club has premiered over twenty new arrangements and compositions.

name.text: ELMAC 20th Anniversary Conference
name.html: ELMAC 20th Anniversary Conference

description.text:
Welcome to the ELMAC 20th Anniversary Conference!  We can’t wait to see you and to talk together about the important work of teaching in 2017 and beyond.  Alumni and ELMAC faculty have planned a lively day full of opportunities for you to reunite with other educators and reinvigorate your teaching by sharing your stories of practice and reflecting on your work in the company of other committed educators.  We’ll have a Zingerman’s lunch and many moments for enjoying each other’s company!
Participants will include ELMAC alumni, mentor teachers, faculty and staff from across the years, current and prospective students, and others who have been affiliated with ELMAC in many ways.  If you are not able to attend in person, we invite you to register to participate in selected sessions online.
Sessions will include a keynote address by Professor Deborah Ball;  several moderated “unconference” discussion sessions on topics nominated by participants; and “Teacher to Teacher” 15-20 minute roundtable sessions, where you can share a practice, idea, or insight about your own work with other educators. If you are interested in presenting at a Teacher to Teacher session, submit your idea here.
We look forward to seeing you on November 11!

Schedule of Events:8:30 - 9:00 a.m. - Coffee and light breakfast9:00 - 10:00 a.m. - Keynote and discussion: Deborah Ball, Professor and Former Dean, School of Education10:30 a.m. - 12:30 p.m. - “Unconference” conversation sessions (topics generated and led by participants)12:30 - 1:30 p.m. - Lunch: Catered by Zingerman’s1:30 - 2:35 p.m. - Teacher to Teacher Sessions2:40 - 3:00 p.m. - Closing Circles

At the successful completion of class, a link will be emailed to you so you can print your own certification. You will be certified by the American Red Cross. The CCRB opens at 8:00 am. name.text: CBD 101
name.html: CBD 101

description.text:
What is CBD?
How does it work?
What are the health benefits?
How can it help me?
 
This Month's Cannabis Classroom is featuring Blue Sage Health Consulting.  Blue Sage Health’s mission is to educate and empower you to achieve your highest quality of life with the use of plant based cannabidiol (CBD).  CBD is a compound that research has shown to reduce anxiety and has analgesic and anti-inflammatory properties.  Learn about the endocannabinoid system and how it is very important in maintaining health. We will discuss all the different ways it can be used and how you can benefit from daily supplementation. There will be a presentation on CBD followed by a question and answer session with our expert CBD Consultant Julie!  We are excited to share with you this incredibly safe, non-pharmaceutical alternative! We hope to see you there!

At  Crazy Wisdom  114 S Main St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
November 13th at 6:30-7:30pm

Sponsored by BlueSageHealth.com

name.text: @home: A Documentary Film Exploring Homelessness in America
name.html: @home: A Documentary Film Exploring Homelessness in America

description.text:
Join the Washtenaw Housing Alliance in recognition of National Hunger & Homelessness Awareness Week, for a special screening of the documentary film @home, a journey through the landscape of a forgotten America — the invisible communities of people living without permanent housing. 
The film explores homelessness through the lens of activist Mark Horvath, as he talks with people across the country about their experiences living on the street and in shelters, who are finding their way back home. 
Admission includes light bites and a drink ticket from Zingerman's. There will be an opportunity for Q+A after the film. 
*Tickets are non-refundable.

description.text:
Aventura began, like many seductive ideas, with a creative human and an experience. When restaurateur Sava Lelcaj bought the building you’re sitting in, out of pure fascination plus great timing, she immediately fell in love with the history, the patina, the personality of the space, but perhaps most significantly, with—a table.
She gathered her friends around that table, in the cavern-like basement of this building, and was immediately transported to another place. Old World, wine and cheese, music and conversation, candlelight… tapas.
That same table now sits in the middle of Aventura restaurant,a continuing symbol of Sava and her team’s coming together over the love of authentic Spanish cuisine and culture; tapas, paella, cocas, vino, gin tonics. Literally carved from the bones of the original space (b. 1872) and utilizing classic Spanish design elements paired with works by local artists, the dining room and bar are intentionally intertwined, reiterating the deeply social experience of traditional Catalan and Valencian-style tapas bars.
We invite you to eat, drink, laugh and linger here; to enjoy the company of those you love as well as those you don’t yet know. 
Aventura is a love affair, a Cupid’s arrow from us to you.

name.text: Introduction to DSLR Photography with George Borel
name.html: Introduction to DSLR Photography with George Borel

description.text:
Class Description
Need help getting started with your DSLR or Mirrorless Interchangeable Lens Camera? This is the perfect class for getting started.
In this class, George will cover the basics of digital photography, helping you to understand the physics of photography, so you can start taking more control of your photos. He will also offer some strategies to increase the quality of your everyday photos with some great photo tips.

Some of the topics that are covered:
- Elements of Exposure (Shutter speed, Aperture, ISO)
- What is a Digital Image? (Pixels, Resolution, Compression)
- Basics of a good image (subject, composition, color, contrast)
- Next level of image making (depth of field, lighting, point of view, macro)
- Moving out of P mode (A, S, M)


Do I need to pre-register?
Yes, we have limited seating, so pre-registration is required. Class costs $40, and if you have purchased a camera or lens with us, you are welcome to select "Free Entry."



Class is held at CameraMall 
Our address: 518 E Washington St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Having trouble finding us?
Our store is located in the building immediately to the east of the liberty square parking garage--we're right next door to Name Brand Tattoo and across the street from the First United Methodist Church. We have bright yellow Nikon awnings. We're located at the star in the image below. If you're still having trouble finding us, feel free to give us a call at 734-997-5031.

name.text: Know Us Project Pilot Training
name.html: Know Us Project Pilot Training

description.text:
As we see more frequent, blatant forms of injustice, including racism, xenophobia, islamophobia, and transphobia, in the mainstream, what can we do? How can we reduce prejudice in our communities? In a time when everyone seems entrenched and polarized, how can you help others understand your social justice perspective?  What can you do to activate people to social justice?
The Know Us Project builds up participants’ abilities to make empowered individual and social change through personal communications and connections. KUP participants learn effective ways to share your personal stories of prejudice and stigma – as members of targeted communities and/or as supporters of justice for those who have been targeted. 
Join us to learn strategies for how to use perspective taking, values-based messaging, and personal connections in communication to help others know us better. These conversations can empower you to change public opinion and public policy by building support for social justice and equality at the grassroots level.

Learn and practice effective KUP conversations using Five KUP Conversation Skills.
Create your own KUP Conversation Action Plan that fits your personal goals – whether it is personal equality or social justice.
Offered in a supportive, informative, stimulating, and positive environment.

Pre-registration is required.
COST: $10 per person
WHEN: Sunday November 19, 2:00 PM - 5:00 PM WHERE: Ann Arbor Friends Meeting (Fellowship Hall, downstairs), 1414 Hill St, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
For more info contact, Germaine, germaine@icpj.org or 734-663-1870

description.text:
Interfaith Council for Peace and Justice inspires, educates, and mobilizes people to unite across differences and to act from their shared ethical and spiritual values in pursuit of peace with social and environmental justice.
Interfaith Council for Peace and Justice envisions a world free from violence, including the violence of war, poverty, oppression, and environmental devastation. To enact this vision, we commit to nurture a community in which compassion and respect foster actions that dismantle systems of violence while simultaneously creating systems of peace, justice, and ecological sustainability.

description.text:
We’ve invited our new-to-Michigan friends from Revolution Brewing Co. to join us for this months beer dinner. We’ve taken some of their best and rarest beers and matched them perfectly with a brilliant food menu created by our wonderful chefs.
 
Welcoming Beer:
Cross of Gold - American Golden Ale - 4.8%
First Course: 
Pumpkin Fritters - Pan Fried Pumpkin Fritters Drizzled w/ a Brown Sugar & Cinnamon Sauce.
Paired w/  Fistmas - American Red Ale w/ Ginger Root & Orange Peel – 6.1%
Second Course:  
Citrus IPA Kale Salad - Fresh Kale topped w/ Orange Segments, Candied Walnuts, Goat Cheese & an Amarillo Hero Vinaigrette.
Paired w/ Amarillo Hero - Single-Hopped American IPA w/ Amarillo Hops - 7.2% 
Third Course: 
Bourbon Braised Short Ribs - Beef Short Ribs Smothered in Bourbon Beef Gravy. Served w/ Grilled Asparagus & Garlic Whipped Potatoes.

Dessert:
 Coffee Crème Brulee - Coffee Bean Infused Crème Brulee w/ a Coffee Eugene Chocolate Drizzle.
Paired w/  Coffee Eugene - American Porter w/ Dark Matter Coffee - 7%

name.text: How to Photograph Sports with Marc-Gregor Campredon
name.html: How to Photograph Sports with Marc-Gregor Campredon

description.text:
The Class
Interested in getting better pictures of your kids playing sports? Often we try to get those candid pictures but we simply miss them--they're out of frame, out of focus, the action is blurred, and they just don't look sharp. We can help you get the shots you're looking for! Join us for our sports photography class led by Marc-Grégor Campredon! 
MG will be covering- The relationship between ISO, Aperture and Shutter Speed.
- Anticipating the light for sharp images.
- Getting the most out of your Auto-Focus.
- Improving Framing.
The class will be limited in size (no more than 15 people can register), so you will be able to receive individual attention if you have questions!

The Instructor
 Marc-Gregor, also known as "MG", was formerly trained in photography in France and is a well-known pro sports and humanitarian photographer who shoots Michigan sports! Learn more about MG here: https://www.facebook.com/marcgregorphotography/

Testimonials
"I got a chance to use everything I learned last night! The class answered a lot of the questions that I had and taught me how to correct them. I highly recommend the class for anyone that is trying to photograph their kids' sporting events."
